alert.note: Alert for Grand Traverse; Leelanau (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 7:31PM EDT until June 25 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL GRAND TRAVERSE AND SOUTH CENTRAL LEELANAU COUNTIES... At 731 PM EDT, Heavy rain has fallen in and around the Traverse City area this afternoon. Rainfall of 2.23 inches between 2pm and 7pm was reported at Cherry Capital Airport...with radar rainfall estimates from 1.50 to 2.50 inches across southeast Leelanau and northern Grand Traverse counties during the afternoon hours. Heaviest rainfall has lifted to the northeast but light rain will continue to fall into this evening with an additional 0.25 to 0.50 inch of rain likely. Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Traverse City. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and rain gauge reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Traverse City, Traverse City State Park, Greilickville, Grawn, Williamsburg, Interlochen. This includes the following streams and drainages... Boardman River, Williamsburg Creek, Yuba Creek, Cedar Run Creek, Acme Creek, Mitchell Creek, Kids Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
